title: Bryan and Sara’s Story
text:
Bryan and Sara met back in November 2017 through OkCupid. Sara picked up Bryan on the side of the road on their way to Crissy Field and Fort Point for their first date in San Francisco. This was the first of many walks, dates, and hikes in the first 6 years of a lifetime together.

San Francisco Bay Area, Japan Town



Monroe Michigan, Lake Erie



Colorado, Breckenridge



Japan, Kyoto and Tokyo




California, Monterey



Hawaii, Big Island
Now, we’d like you to join us as we celebrate our marriage with a casual get-together in Hawaii, a place we enjoyed as a couple in early 2023.






 Back to top

title: Ceremony & Reception
text:
Papa Kona Restaurant & Bar  Address: The Waterfront Row, 75-5770 Ali’i Dr 1st Floor, Kailua-Kona, HI 96740 
Ceremony: The lawn out back at Papa Kona
Reception: 2nd floor lanai (cocktail hour followed by dinner, lawn games, and music)
Parking: The on-site parking is on the expensive side (we read online it’s $13/hour without validation). There is limited street parking along Ali’i drive or near the Kailua-Kona Public Library about a block away.

title: Where to Stay
text: We contacted a few hotels about room blocks, but none of them provided competitive discounts. Since the rate for hotels has a wide range on the Big Island, we decided not to reserve a room block so our guests could feel free to choose where to stay. There are a variety of lodging options close to the venue. Listed below are just a few options we found on Google, and our price information below is as of October 2023, before taxes and fees.

title: What Else to Do
text:
Bryan and Sara are planning to do the Captain Cook reef snorkeling boat tour with Kona Coast Boat Tour on April 22nd afternoon. Please join us if you are also interested in snorkeling in Kealakekua Bay.
If you are planning to explore around the Big Island before or after the wedding, here are some links that could be useful. We have done some of the activities below ourselves, but some of the links are just the highly rated options from Google search.

title: RSVP
text:
We are honored to have you as our guests on our special day, but we totally understand if you can’t make it for whatever reason. Please fill out this Google form to RSVP by February 21st, 2024.
Your presence is our present, so we won’t have a wedding gift registry.



 Back to top

title: Ceremony & Reception
text:
When
Sunday April 21st, 2024
Ceremony is at 4:30PM, please arrive at Papa Kona by 4:10PM. There will be a cocktail hour with passed appetizers, followed by a dinner buffet, lawn games and music. The party ends at 10PM.
Attire: Casual. E.g. Aloha (Hawaiian) shirts and sundresses

title: What Else to Do
text:
Car Rental

Discount Hawaii Car Rental
Autoslash Car Rental

title: What Else to Do
text:
Things to Do

Volcanoes National Park
Snorkeling

Kikaua Point Park (kid-friendly), we checked this out ourselves and we love it.

Kealakekua Bay (by boat), tour options on Tripadvisor
Night Snorkel with Manta Rays, please Google for more options, there are so many

Beaches

Laʻaloa / White Sands Beach
Maniniowali Beach
Hapuna Beach, entrance fee $5 per person and parking fee $10 per car
Spencer Beach Park (kid-friendly)

Coffee farm tours

Greenwell Farms tour, free guided tour
Heavenly Hawaiian Farms tour


If you are looking for a comprehensive Big Island guide, we found a lot of great information on The Hawaii Vacation Guide. Have fun!

title: Where to Stay
section: Within walking distance of our wedding venue:
text:
Within walking distance of our wedding venue:

Royal Kona Resort
Address: 75-5852 Ali’i Dr, Kailua-Kona, HI 96740

We think this one is the best value for what it is. Standard room rates started at $239/night.

Courtyard by Marriott King Kamehameha’s Kona Beach Hotel

Address: 75-5660 Palani Rd, Kailua-Kona, HI 96740

This hotel is more expensive, with rates around $400/night. They do have a little beach and it’s also a Marriott property if you have points with the brand.

title: Where to Stay
text:
10-15 minute drive from the venue:

Kanaloa at Kona by Outrigger

Address: 78-261 Manukai St, Kailua-Kona, HI 96740

Waterfront condos. They have full kitchens. $269/night for a 2 bed/2 bath


Outrigger Kona Resort & Spa

Address: 78-128 Ehukai St, Kailua-Kona, HI 96740

Room rates are around $300 - $400. They have a nice pool.
If you prefer to have a full kitchen during your stay, we also recommend looking into airbnb or vrbo.

title: Where to Stay
text:
Within walking distance:

Royal Kona Resort
Address: 75-5852 Ali’i Dr, Kailua-Kona, HI 96740

We think this one is the best value for what it is. Standard room rates started at $239/night.

Courtyard by Marriott King Kamehameha’s Kona Beach Hotel

Address: 75-5660 Palani Rd, Kailua-Kona, HI 96740

This hotel is more expensive, with rates around $400/night. They do have a little beach and it’s also a Marriott property if you have points with the brand.

title: Where to Stay
text:
10-15 minute drive away:

Kona Coast Resort
Address: 78-6842 Ali‘i Dr, Kailua-Kona, HI 96740

Condo units with full kitchens. ~$260/night for a 2 bed/2 bath. We notice somehow the tax and fee charge for this resort is significantly less than the other options on hotels.com.

Kanaloa at Kona by Outrigger

Address: 78-261 Manukai St, Kailua-Kona, HI 96740

Waterfront condos with full kitchens. $269/night for a 2 bed/2 bath.


Outrigger Kona Resort & Spa

Address: 78-128 Ehukai St, Kailua-Kona, HI 96740

Room rates are around $300 - $400. They have a nice pool.
If you prefer to have a full kitchen during your stay, we also recommend looking into airbnb or vrbo. Please don’t hesitate to reach out to us if you have any questions.

title: Ceremony & Reception
text:
The Day Before The Ceremony
We are hosting a welcome gathering at Ola Brew Co. between 4:00 to 8:00PM. There will be food provided and a cash bar.
